Package eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.util.local

Class CryptoACLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.util.local.CryptoACLogger
  • public class CryptoACLogger
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for logging errors, warnings and info in Application. Just modify the log function to redirect all the logs. As of now, they are printed in the console. This class supports indentation for logs. Just call the "startOfFunction" and "endOfFunction" functions

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int verbosityLevel
      the verbosity level: the higher the value the more will be displayed 0: output only errors 1 output errors and warnings 2: (default): output log, warnings and errors 3: log literally everything

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      CryptoACLogger()

                            java.lang.String methodInvokingLogger,
                            java.lang.String logErrorMessage,
                            java.lang.Throwable e)
        log an error with an exception by invoking the log inner function
        Parameters:
        classInvokingLogger - the class invoking the logger
        methodInvokingLogger - the method of the class invoking the logger
        logErrorMessage - the error message to log
        e - the exception to log

      • logStartingInfo

        public static void logStartingInfo​(java.lang.String classInvokingLogger,
                                   java.lang.String methodInvokingLogger,
                                   java.lang.String logInfoMessage)
        log an info by invoking the log inner function. This log should be invoked at the beginning of a function to indent the log messages
        Parameters:
        classInvokingLogger - the class invoking the logger
        methodInvokingLogger - the method of the class invoking the logger
        logInfoMessage - the info message to log

      • startOfFunction

        public static void startOfFunction()
        notify that what follows it the starting of a new function, thus increment the indentation factor

        public static void endOfFunction()
        notify that what follows it the ending of a function, thus decrement the indentation factor
